column2: MONTANA DMV PRACTICE TEST
column6: MT

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. The effects of alcohol on driving do NOT include:
column6: Better reflexes
column8: Improved coordination

column2: 2. A work zone:
column4: is marked with black and white signs.
column6: might involve vehicles and moving workers.
column8: does not require that the driver slow down and pay extra attention.

column2: 3. When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights behind you, you must:
column4: pull over to the right and stop.
column6: drive to the right edge of the road and slow down.
column8: slow down and keep moving.
column10: stop as quickly as you can.

column2: 4. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column4: To decrease the state average speed statistic.
column6: To halt the traffic flow.
column8: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.
column10: To keep a smooth traffic flow.

column2: 5. You want to turn left at an intersection ahead. A car reaches the intersection from the opposite direction and moves straight ahead. You:
column4: can turn left. You have the right of way.
column6: must wait for the car to go through before you turn.
column8: may not enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green.
column10: must make a U-turn and then turn right.

column2: 6. This sign means:
column4: Warning: a bikeway crosses the roadway ahead.
column6: The lane ahead is reserved for bicycles.
column8: Bicycle zone ahead.
column10: Bicycles should yield to vehicles ahead.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column6: Intersection
column8: No Passing Zone

column2: 8. If a traffic officer signals you to drive through a red light:
column6: you must call the police.
column8: you must not obey the officer. Signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.
column10: you must wait for the red light to turn green.

column2: 9. When driving on slick roads, drivers should:
column6: use alternate routes.
column8: drive as they would on dry roads.

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column6: Flagger ahead
column8: Pedestrian crossing

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column6: Crossroad
column8: Merge

column2: 12. When a traffic signal light turns green, you should:
column6: yield the right-of-way to pedestrians.
column8: yield the right-of-way to larger vehicles.

column2: 13. When driving behind a motorcycle, drivers must:
column4: drive on the shoulder beside the motorcycle.
column6: pass the motorcycle in the same lane.
column8: remembers that motorcyclists have the right to use a complete traffic lane.
column10: share the lane with the motorcycle.

column2: 14. This sign warns drivers of:
column6: a bridge ahead, wide enough to accommodate two lanes of traffic, but with very little clearance.
column8: a narrow road ahead.
column10: a dip in the road. Drivers should be ready to stop if the dip is filled with water.

column2: 15. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column6: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
column8: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
column10: another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 16. This signal means:
column6: Proceed
column8: Slow down

column2: 17. This sign indicates:
column6: Double curve ahead
column8: Divided highway ends

column2: 18. This road sign means:
column6: Railroad Warning
column8: No Passing Zone

column2: 19. This sign means:
column6: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column8: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column6: Low clearance
column8: No U-turns

column2: 21. Drivers can proceed through an intersection with a stop sign, but no stop line or crosswalk:
column4: after stopping at least 50 feet prior to the intersection.
column6: after coming to a complete stop, when it is safe to proceed.
column8: after slowing down to ensure there is no cross-traffic.
column10: after slowing down to at least 15 MPH before proceeding.

column2: 22. When parallel parking between two cars, you should first:
column6: pull up even with the front car.
column8: turn your wheels to the right.
column10: turn your wheels to the left.

column2: 23. When passing you should NOT:
column4: leave less than 4 feet of space between your vehicle and the vehicle you are passing.
column6: go far enough past the vehicle you are passing so that you can see the vehicle in your inside rearview mirror.
column8: signal left to let others know that you will be pulling out.
column10: look in your rearview mirrors and glance over your shoulder before pulling out to pass.

column2: 24. Select the most effective safety restraint(s) in a traffic crash.
column4: A combination of lap/shoulder belt and air bag.
column6: Lap and shoulder belt only
column8: Air bag only

column2: 25. You may not park:
column6: on a crosswalk or marked bicycle lane.
column8: in a parking lot.
column10: within 200 feet of an elementary school.

column2: 26. To enter a freeway:
column4: signal and enter the freeway. You have the right-of-way.
column6: drive slowly so you can check traffic.
column8: make a complete stop before entering the freeway.
column10: signal, yield, and enter at the same speed that traffic is moving.

column2: 27. When drivers see this road sign:
column4: they must treat it as a 4-Way Stop sign.
column6: they must come to a complete stop and call the police.
column8: they must not drive past this sign.

column2: 28. Which of the following drugs could affect your ability to drive?
column6: Tranquilizers.
column8: A cold remedy.

column2: 29. This road sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must turn either to the right or left.
column6: they must change lane immediately.
column8: the one-way street or roadway ahead ends.

column2: 30. The sign in the picture:
column4: shows the highest speed drivers can travel at the exit of the intersection.
column6: is used to advise motorists of the appropriate ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column8: indicates the minimum ramp speed at the highway exit point.

column2: 31. In the following situations, drivers should increase their following interval:
column6: When it is hard to see ahead because of bad weather.
column8: When following vehicles that are required to come to a stop at railroad crossings.

column2: 32. Drivers may continue carefully through a yellow light if:
column4: they already are within the intersection.
column6: they are turning right.
column8: there are no pedestrians crossing.
column10: an emergency vehicle is crossing your lane.

column2: 33. Bicyclists must:
column4: remain near the left edge of the road.
column6: remain to the right when they prepare for a left turn.
column8: ride in a bicycle lane, if available.
column10: travel with more than two side-by-side in a single lane, if possible.

column2: 31. In the following situations, drivers should increase their following interval:
column6: When it is hard to see ahead because of bad weather.
column8: When following vehicles that are required to come to a stop at railroad crossings.

column2: 32. Drivers may continue carefully through a yellow light if:
column4: they already are within the intersection.
column6: they are turning right.
column8: there are no pedestrians crossing.
column10: an emergency vehicle is crossing your lane.

column2: 33. Bicyclists must:
column4: remain near the left edge of the road.
column6: remain to the right when they prepare for a left turn.
column8: ride in a bicycle lane, if available.
column10: travel with more than two side-by-side in a single lane, if possible.
